ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] OT - Final Fantasy X
ygData.msgSnippet: Kaz wrote: The same thing that s wrong with the actual adventuring interface: Endless dialog boxes. They expect you to slowly sit through their damned,
ygData.messageBody:
Kaz wrote:
The same thing that's wrong with the actual adventuring interface:

Endless dialog boxes.

They expect you to slowly sit through their damned, unabortable text
blabber,
no matter how much faster you can read (or, in the cases of other people,
how
much they'd prefer audio so they didn't have to work at reading).

*** Ah, good point. It's especially annoying when you are going through
something over & over again (e.g. Jecht shot, if you're playing FF X) &
have to watch the same animation over & over.

With the combat interface, it's (again) this pathetic stop-action setup,
with constant pauses to navigate endless dialog boxes.

*** That doesn't bother me. Actually...I like it. They should put in an
option for real time strategy if it's not there already, since some
(including Kaz, I guess) find time stopping a bit too easy. For me it's a
refreshing change of pace from EQ, which frequently comes down to hand-eye
coordination. If I want a *difficult* game I'll pickup where I left off on
each of the Tomb Raiders.

Peace
Evulia of Tunare
